intro: Barleria fulvostellata, commonly known as the yellow barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Barleria fulvostellata is often found in open grasslands and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
